resources.string: 1. Crocodile is the closest living relative to Tyrannosaurus Rex.
2. Hummingbirds can have heart rate of 1260 beats per minutes.
3. Elephants have the lowest heart rate among mammals.
4. Select all the correct answers, which of the following is true for the human brain.
A. The brain can not feel pain itself.
B. The brain is much more active at night than during the day.
C. While awake, the brain generates 10â€“23 watts of power, which is enough energy to power a light bulb.
D. The brain is the most selfish organ. It weighs only 2 percents of body weight but it consumes 20 percents of the total oxygen and 25 percents of the total energy of the body.
5. What is the largest known protein? Hint: its chemical name is the longest word in English and it would take three and half hours to pronounce it correctly.
